page.title: 05Societies in St. Agnes
page.content: There are strong W.I's at St. Agnes, St. Agnes Breannick, and Mithian. The Gardening Association has a very large membership and stages two very successful Produce and Craft shows each year. Scouts, Guides, Cubs, and Brownies are run for the younger element. A Miners and Mechanics Institute, which is perhaps the wealthiest group in the village, exists for the men. A Monday Club provides an interest for ladies of all ages, with demonstrators and speakers offering a wide variety. One of the more recently formed groups is the St. Agnes Museum Trust whose main objective is to preserve old buildings and other items of interest. A Floral Art Club stages exhibitions in the Church Hall. An Age Concern caravan in the car park provides morning coffee on weekdays.
